mention.text: Ava DuVernay 's ` 13th ' Explores The Evolution Of The U.S. Prison System .
one thing that Ava DuVernay is more passionate about than the present-day reality of black life in America
her push to help people understand the past so America 's sordid history in mistreating black Americans is n't repeated
Correction : An earlier version of this article incorrectly listed when the `` War On Drugs '' was introduced .
America 's sordid history in mistreating black Americans is n't repeated
The film , which debuts on Netflix Friday
the 13th amendment in the U.S. constitution which abolished slavery also
the current mass incarceration of black people
no context for the current moment
our overall collective thinking about this moment
a tremendous spike , much of which can be credited to the aggressive laws proposed during President Richard Nixon 's term in office during the 1970s

the `` War On Drugs , '' which not only came with discriminative laws that over-policed , targeted and criminalized black men but also introduced racist rhetoric that wildly painted and perceived all black men
his wife and current Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton
the executive director at the Center of Media Justice and whose also featured in the film , told The Huffington Post
